Ruins of old cities dot Epsilon lndi's desolate surface, and many of these have become home for the thousands of refugees from the city of Krist. The ruins also often house criminals and bandits, who prey on people traveling between Epsilon lndi's towns and cities.  Epsilon lndi is a wasteland of deserts, empty seabeds, and bombed-out cities. Life and human habitation on the planet is confined to the polar regions, the only areas clear of fallout from the nuclear weapons that Amaris the Usurper used to subdue Epsilon lndi when he attempted to take over the Star League. After the League's collapse, the Capellan Confederation claimed the world but devoted few resources to restoring it.

Gallery.desc:
Star Type: M5V Recharge Time: hrs Position: 1 of Satellites: 1 Gravity: 1.03 Pressure: Standard Atmosphere: Breathable Climate: 27 Temperature: Cool-Temperate Water: 88% Transit Time: 2.52 hrs Native Life: None Population: 681000000 Recharge Stations: ZN HPG: B Planet Notes: B&W Logo in handbook. 4 continents. Mining. The world of Gallery presents a barren surface. The system's weak sun cannot penetrate the perpetual heavy cloud cover, and the planet is constantly swept by violent storms. The one attack ever made on Gallery, by the Free Worlds League, was a dismal failure. Visual scans are useless on the surface, and the chilling storms drastically reduce equipment's effectiveness. Would-be attackers who somehow avoid scattering on their drop or deployment must locate their objective on a terrain devoid of either natural or man-made landmarks, as Gallery's main industries are located far from its few squat cities.

The planet is honeycombed with long tunnels left by miningbots making extensive journeys for the rare pockets of gems and metals Gallery yields. The League raiders never exited the tunnels, most likely dying of starvation.Darkest and moodiest worlds with stormy client from 3 seas and a large moon.

Genoa.desc:
Recharge Time: 197 hrs
Transit Time: 1 hrs
Recharge Stations: -
HPG: B
Planet Notes: When a passing meteor forced the planet Genoa into a brief journey outside its orbit millenia ago, the world's lush plant life and plentiful animal life lost their fragile hold and died off, leaving only the dry, rocky, marginally habitable place that the smallest population of any system in a 60-light-year radius of Terra now calls home. The planet's attraction now lies in its rich deposits of raw materials-always in demand by industry-and high-grade gemstones. When the world's harsh surface drove settlers to make their homes underground, the population discovered huge underground lakes teeming with many unique aquatic species. The current citizens carefully nurture and harvest certain fish and export them as delicacies and as exotic pets.

Hall's annual precipitation is far below the average for Terra, which gives the planet several large deserts. Considered one of the most beautiful worlds in known space, Hall owes this reputation to the strange, compelling rock formations found in each of the planet's deserts. From the air, it can be seen that many of these formations consist of solid walls of rock about five meters thick and sometimes more than two hundred meters long and of varying heights. The most unique feature of these formations is that most of the rock walls run parallel to one another, creating a vast complex of hallways.

Planet Notes: The planet Jeanette is one big ocean. Though a few islands are sprinkled across the planet's surface, the only sizable solid surfaces are the polar ice caps. The Nova Cats are fond of battling at the edge of the icesheets, in constant peril of being caught on one of the great bergs that thunder free to drift across the open water.

Jeronimo.desc:
Transit Time: 12 hrs Planet Notes: The northern continent of Jeronimo is blanketed by a forest of huge trees. This ancient woodland made such a powerful impression on the women and men who colonized this world that many chose to relinquish the comforts of "civilization" in order to live among the branches of these giants.

When the Draconis Combine claimed the planet in 2320, the people of Jeronimo accepted their new rulers without comment. The industrial cities of the southern continent welcomed membership in a larger, more powerful nation, and abundant fossil fuels made plundering the northern forest uneconomical. (Or perhaps even the soldiers of the Combine were impressed by the ancient forest.) The forest's inhabitants were allowed to continue their isolated life unmolested.

The Smoke Jaguars appear to hold the northern wood in the same awed reverence experienced by all inhabitants of this world.

The foliage is too dense for aircraft to penetrate, but jump-capable 'Mechs with hand actuators can travel the lower and mid-level branches with a fair degree of success, and the forest is said to be a LAM's paradise.

Marik.desc:
Star Type: K0V Recharge Time: hrs Position: 2 of Satellites: 2 Gravity: 1.1 Pressure: High Atmosphere: Breathable Climate: 40 Temperature: Arid Water: 55% Transit Time: 5.48 hrs Native Life: Mammals Population: 4780000000 Recharge Stations: ZN HPG: A Planet Notes: B&W Logo in handbook. Industrial. This mined-out desert planet offers mostly symbolic reward to successful raiders, as its current value lies in its historical and emotional importance to the people of the Free Worlds League. lmstar AeroSpace also maintains a plant here.

Captain General Marik's winter palace is also on Marik,and so any invader must take into account the presence of his personal guard.

Marik's fierce summer dust storms can cloak a small force's approach, but they are accompanied by tornados strong enough to damage lighter 'Mechs and conventional vehicles. Metal rich planet. Terran sized with slightly higher gravity. Hot/dry climate. Dust storms/tornadoes are common in summer.

Transit Time: 4 hrs
Recharge Stations: N

Planet Notes: Lush forests and jungles spring from fertile soil.  Defended by Sheratan Knights (2 conventional BN, V/F, Lieutenant Colonel Toby Knight).  A sparsely inhabited, forest-covered world with thick jungles around the equator, Sheratan is one of the most beautiful planets in the Sarna March. During the invasion, it became one of the most bitterly contested.  Sheratan's lush northern forests and equatorial jungles spring from fertile soil, ideal for growing various fruits and vegetables from throughout the Inner Sphere. The Sarna March invasion has turned large stretches of Sheratan's woodlands into blackened wasteland, as the fires set during the initial battles for the planet continue to burn out of control. Some of these blazes have died out of their own accord, others have been stamped out by the de facto leaders of Sheratan's towns and cities. Enough of the planet is still burning, however, to fill the sky with a gray haze.

Aea.desc: The Aurigans and the Taurian Concordat contest this system.

Artru.desc: Rumored to house ruins of a Star League Castle.

Bringdam.desc: Notable agricultural world, supplies several nearby worlds.

Enkra.desc: Formerly a mining world, over-exploitation has led to it redefining itself as a agricultural world.

Fjaldr.desc: A mostly barren ice planet. Its mainly exploited for its rich mineral resources.

Gangtok.desc: Fairly unremarkable Terran-like world, recently recieved a influx in prospectors, merchants and colonists.

Guldra.desc: Notable Aurigan agritech center, exporting genetically modified seeds, farming equipment, and more.

Ichlangis.desc: Cold, waterless world with easy access to rich titanium deposits.

Itron.desc: One of the planets involved in the Aurigan Trade Partnership.

Katinka.desc: Its ecosystem was nearly destroyed by a orbital mass driver attack in the Periphery Uprising.

Mechdur.desc: Major industrial hub of the Aurigan Coalition.

Qalzi.desc: Cold and rocky Terran-Like. Contested by the Taurians.

Panzyr.desc: Seat of House Decimis of the Aurigan Coalition, recently devastated by the civil war.

Regis Roost.desc: Filled with fungal life, visitors are prone to a illness known as Spore-lung.

Ryans Fate.desc: Industry consists of flood farming and mining of high-quality crystals and fissionables

Smithon.desc: Former home of House Karosas, its now ran by the planetary govenor, it's sustained by agroponic farming.

Tyrlon.desc: Major agricultural center based around the major river system thats on the southern hemisphere of the planet.

Umgard.desc: Jungle world teeming with life but sever earthquake and volcanic activity due to tidal stress from the two moons

Weldry.desc: Notable stop on the route to herotitus or the Magistracy of Canopus, the small population focuses on manufacturing and agriculture

Zangul.desc: A cold world, inhabited at a old decaying starport.
